SEARCH
Package com.glamdring.greenZenith.handlers.formats

Class GZFormatter

java.lang.Object
com.glamdring.greenZenith.handlers.formats.GZFormatter
public class GZFormatter extends Object
Aids in making comparisons with certain established and predefined formats, and a specific input value, providing a concise and decisive result that determines if a pattern of a regular expression is met or not.
Since:
0.2
Version:
1.1.0
See Also:
  • GZFormats

    Field
    Description
    private static Matcher

    pattern

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GZFormatter()
    Creates a new Formatter, capable of checking if a string is within a certain boundary or if it follows a certain predefined or given pattern.

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public static boolean isValid(String input, GZFormats format)
      Realizes a comparison, with respect to a selected format, converted into a pattern, to determine if the input given is valid in regards to the predefined regular expression pattern. Has a check for if the given parameter is null or blank.
      Parameters:
      input - The value to make comparisons with.
      format - The predefined format to look for and check in a comparison. See GZFormats
      Returns:
      Approves or negates the validity of the input.

    • isValid

      public static boolean isValid(String input, String format)
      Realizes a comparison, with respect to a given format, converted into a pattern, to determine if the input given is valid in regards to the given regular expression pattern. Has a check for if the given parameter is null or blank.
      Parameters:
      input - The value to make comparisons with.
      format - The format to look for and check in a comparison.
      Returns:
      Approves or negates the validity of the input.

    • isValidMaxLength

      public static boolean isValidMaxLength(String input, int maxLength)
      Checks if the length of a given string is within an upper boundary. Has a check for if the given parameter is null or blank.
      Parameters:
      input - The string whose length needs to be validated.
      maxLength - The maximum length it can be.
      Returns:
      Approves or negates the validity of the input.

    • isValidMinLength

      public static boolean isValidMinLength(String input, int minLength)
      Checks if the length of a given string is within a lower boundary. Has a check for if the given parameter is null or blank.
      Parameters:
      input - The string whose length needs to be validated.
      minLength - The minimum length it can be.
      Returns:
      Approves or negates the validity of the input.

    • isValidLength

      public static boolean isValidLength(String input, int minLength, int maxLength)
      Checks if the length of a given string is within an upper and lower boundary. Has a check for if the given parameter is null or blank.
      Parameters:
      input - The string whose length needs to be validated.
      minLength - The maximum length it can be.
      maxLength - The minimum length it can be.
      Returns:
      Approves or negates the validity of the input.
